function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inadequate primary health care system and supplies during covid-19 crises","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of educational programs due to closure of formal education systems","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High per-capita electricity consumption in residential buildings","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of implementation of external shading and evaporative cooling strategies in residential buildings in hot arid climate","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Trend towards culturally and climatically responsive designs may not be sufficient to reduce energy consumption","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential poor workmanship in construction of residential units","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Occupants’ proximity in small spaces","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Multi-functional rooms","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on kerosene lamps for lighting","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High energy consumption due to affluent lifestyle","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of energy conservation awareness","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High government subsidy leading to low energy cost","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Data collected from a specific group may not be representative of the overall population of kuwait, leading to biased conclusions.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential privacy concerns and ethical implications due to the private nature of the data collected.","category":"Legal risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of propagation of contagious diseases during the data collection process, especially with the involvement of multiple households.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Occupants’ activities and schedules may contribute to the spread of contagious diseases within the houses.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High energy usage from multiple electrical appliances","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High population density and movement in the residence","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Large number of rooms in each zone of the residence","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Different occupancy patterns in households increase the risk of disease spread due to movement of people between locations","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High occupancy in living rooms from 2:00 to 10:00 p.m. increases the risk of disease transmission due to close contact.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Peak occupancy in the kitchen for lunch and dinner preparation increases the risk of disease transmission during meal preparation times.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High occupancy in the bathrooms during morning routines increases the risk of disease transmission due to shared use of facilities.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Frequent use of electric appliances leads to increased internal heat gain, potentially contributing to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Occupants habitually leaving lights on in unoccupied rooms may lead to poor ventilation and air quality, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Free electricity in kuwait may encourage excessive use of appliances and lighting, leading to higher energy consumption and potential environmental impacts.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High density of tv sets in living rooms and bedrooms increases the risk of airborne disease transmission within households.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Frequent use of personal computers in living rooms and bedrooms increases the risk of surface transmission of contagious diseases within households.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Regular use of vacuum cleaners can lead to the dispersion and circulation of dust, allergens, and pathogens within indoor environments.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Frequent use of washing machines and dryers in the built environment can increase the risk of spreading contagious diseases through contaminated laundry.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Refrigerators are commonly used in kuwaiti residences for storing food, and the presence of multiple units in each residence may lead to cross-contamination if not maintained properly.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Gas-based ovens in kuwait contribute to indoor air quality challenges and may pose a risk if not properly ventilated.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Centralized a/c systems operating all day long and throughout the summer season","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to control a/c unit cycles based on weather conditions","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Default a/c settings leading to high electricity consumption","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inefficient thermostat settings leading to increased energy consumption","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mismatched schedules of lights and occupancy leading to energy waste","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Cultural differences impacting energy consumption patterns","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate representation of local population’s lifestyle and energy consumption habits","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Habit of leaving lights on when rooms are unoccupied due to cheap electricity","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Setting the a/c thermostat to lower temperatures than the comfort range","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Little changes in occupants’ attitude towards energy conservation","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation and infiltration levels in residences, leading to the potential spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor urban communities are most vulnerable to vector-borne diseases vbds due to lack of infrastructure and poor living conditions.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of community participation in disease control efforts reduces the effectiveness of preventative measures and policies.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of integration of health priorities in sustainable development goals could lead to neglect of vbd risks in urban environments.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of awareness about health care costs of urban sprawl","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Heightened surveillance and mosquito control for urban vbd risks","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of investments in improving water storage, sanitation, and drainage in low-income areas","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Urban poverty as a driver of epidemics such as zika","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"}]}
